availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edna Gresham Baker (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and housewife)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Blake Baker in Trigg County, Kentucky, on July 2, 1822. Mother of Leander Baker, Christian F. Baker, Laurinda Baker, Hazard P. Baker, Blake Baker, Thomas K. Baker, Helen E. Baker, Linn B. Baker, Mary E. Baker, and John F. Baker. Resident in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 322A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 48.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Rock Castle, p. 151B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film # 000321335, p. 6.
